definition: a slight error typically due to forgetfulness or inattention
a temporary deviation or fall especially from a higher to a lower state

examples: a lapse in the supply of technicians

definition: the termination of a right or privilege through neglect to exercise it within some limit of time, termination of coverage for nonpayment of premiums
examples: the lapse of an insurance policy
returned to college after a lapse of several years
the roots of trees … have been preserved after a lapse of five thousand years

definition: to fall from an attained and usually high level (as of morals or manners) to one much lower, to depart from an accepted pattern or standard
to go out of existence : cease
examples: after a few polite exchanges, the conversation lapsed

definition: to pass from one proprietor to another or from an original owner by omission or negligence
examples: allowed the insurance policy to lapse
all of those who have lapsed their membership
